title: Weepers from the tomb of Isabella of Bourbon
titles: Ten Weepers from the Tomb of Isabella of Bourbon (1436-1465)
description: Graffiguren, tien, zogenaamde rouwdragers of plorannen, afkomstig van het praalgraf van Isabella van Bourbon.

principalMakers.name: Renier van Thienen (I)
principalMakers.labelDesc: attributed to Renier van Thienen (I) (1465 - before jun-1498), Brussels

acquisition.creditLine: On loan from the City of Amsterdam

longTitle: Weepers from the tomb of Isabella of Bourbon, Borman workshop (attributed to), Renier van Thienen (I) (attributed to), c. 1475 - c. 1476
subTitle: h 55cm × w 23cm × d 14cm
scLabelLine: wooden models: attributed to Jan Borman II (active c. 1475–1520), casting: Renier van Thienen (active c. 1465–1498), Brussels, c. 1475-1476, bronze

label.title: Weepers from the tomb of Isabella of Bourbon
label.makerLine: wooden models: attributed to Jan Borman II (active c. 1475–1520), casting: Renier van Thienen (active c. 1465–1498), Brussels, c. 1475-1476, bronze
label.description: Isabella of Bourbon, wife of Charles the Bold, Duke of Burgundy died in 1465. Their daughter Mary built a funeral monument for her in the abbey of Saint Michael in Antwerp. The tomb was surrounded by 24 figures of mourning family members and ancestors, known as weepers (pleurants). They symbolized the importance of the Burgundy dynasty.
